alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 22 at 2:51PM MDT until March 22 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Periods of heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet and the Upper Rio Grande Valley and the Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Feet. The strongest winds and heaviest snow will occur along ridgeline. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 120 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft
